description: Display of double sided freestanding advertisement panel with LED digital display measuring 2.59m high and 1.08m wide

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential
A4D Class E to residential - CAZ, City Fringe and Major Town Centres

decision_conditions:
<p>The
 proposed advertisement, by reason of its appearance and illumination 
and proximity to the public highway, would result in an obstructive and 
intrusive form of 
development that would reduce the legibility of the footpath by blocking
 lines of sight and creating distractions for highway users to the 
detriment of highway safety. As such the proposed development is 
contrary 
to policies D8 (Public Realm) and&nbsp;<span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">T4 (Assessing and Mitigating Transport Impacts)</span>&nbsp;of
 the London Plan (2021) and policies PP1 (Public Realm), LP7 
(Advertisements), LP41 (Liveable Neighbourhoods), and LP42 (Walking and 
Cycling) of the Hackney Local Plan LP33 (2020).</p><p><br></p>

<p><span style="color:rgb(0,0,0);font-family:&quot;PT Sans&quot;,&quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;,Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif;font-size:14px">The
 proposed advertisement, by reason of its scale, siting, appearance, and
 
method of illumination would result in an excessive and obtrusive 
feature that contributes to an unsightly proliferation of signage and 
street furniture in the local area. The proposal therefore
detracts from the visual amenity of the street scene. As such, the 
proposal is considered unacceptable and fails to comply with policies D4
 (Delivering Good Design) and 
D8 (Public Realm) of the London Plan (2021) and policies PP1 (Public 
Realm), LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character),&nbsp;</span>and LP7 (Advertisements) of Hackney's Local Plan LP33 (2020).<br></p>
